intro: Ainsliaea cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and is known for its delicate, fern-like leaves. It is a perennial herb that produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
